chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dartavian D Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dartavian D Watson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dartavian D Watson was found guilty of Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid by bond on deposit
Statutory costs assessed and paid by bond on deposit.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with any known gang members.   Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Dartavian D Watson in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Parties have reached a resolution. Parties ask for COP/SEH ASAP as parties will rely on the older PSI  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2018 at 01:45 pm.
Racine County Alternatives Program

Charges per attached amended criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random UAs and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program. You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) by 4:00 pm on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm). In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Do not drive.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Do not drive at all.  No contact with the victims, AGC and the family of RLJ (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
